meanings.definition: A vehicle towed behind another vehicle for transporting goods or people.
meanings.sent1: The trailers were filled with furniture for the big move.
meanings.sent2: The trailers on the highway were carrying construction materials.
meanings.sent3: The trailers decided to have a race with the trucks just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The trailers followed the car like loyal companions on a journey.
meanings.sent5: The shiny trailers gleamed in the sunlight as they traveled down the road.

meanings.definition: A short promotional video or clip for a movie or TV show.
meanings.sent1: The trailers for the new movie were exciting and action-packed.
meanings.sent2: I always watch the trailers before deciding which movie to see.
meanings.sent3: The trailers made everyone laugh with their funny scenes.
meanings.sent4: The trailers teased the audience with glimpses of the upcoming film.
meanings.sent5: The trailers created buzz and anticipation for the movie release.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that trails behind or follows another.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was the trailers of her older sister wherever she went.
meanings.sent2: The dog was always the trailers during the family walks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel became the trailers of the park ranger on his rounds.
meanings.sent4: The shadows in the forest seemed like mysterious trailers following the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The falling leaves left a trail of trailers behind the wind.
